intro: Thesium linariae-folium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically less than 2 centimeters in length. The plant produces clusters of pale yellow to greenish-yellow flowers, which are borne in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It is native to parts of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky or sandy soils. Thesium linariae-folium is often found in grasslands and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
